message.content:
cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.SD

This paper deals with the study of a controversial Internet site and the behavior of its members, which falls under the category of computational social science (cs.CY) and social networking and social media (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the challenges of moderating controversial speech and communicating across different ideologies, which could be categorized under computer and society (cs.CC) and cryptography and security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper proposes a model for characterizing perceptions of controversial speech, which could be related to software engineering (cs.SE) or systems and control (cs.SD).
